trans-unit.source: The ErrorResponseException class is an exception that occurs when the server returns an <xref uid="langword_csharp_<errorResponse>" name="<errorResponse>" href=""></xref>.
The ErrorResponseException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class.
The ErrorResponseException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified response object.
The default message displayed to the client is "<errorResponse> returned".

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse"></xref> object returned by the server that corresponds to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<errorResponse>" name="<errorResponse>" href=""></xref>.
The ErrorResponseException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified message.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.
The ErrorResponseException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified response object and message.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse"></xref> object returned by the server that corresponds to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<errorResponse>" name="<errorResponse>" href=""></xref>.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.

The ErrorResponseException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified serialization data and streaming context.
Data required to serialize the parameter.
The source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the parameter.
The ErrorResponseException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified message and inner exception.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*>, if any, that threw the exception.

The ErrorResponseException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified response object, message, and inner exception.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse"></xref> object returned by the server that corresponds to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<errorResponse>" name="<errorResponse>" href=""></xref>.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*>, if any, that threw the exception.
The GetObjectData method populates the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with the data required to serialize the parameter.
Data required to serialize the parameter.
The source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the parameter.

The Response property contains the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse"></xref> object that corresponds to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<errorResponse>" name="<errorResponse>" href=""></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse"></xref> object that corresponds to the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<errorResponse>" name="<errorResponse>" href=""></xref>.
